# Icon Component Usage Guide

## üéØ **Overview**

The Acutrack Design System Icon component provides a consistent, accessible, and flexible way to display Material Symbols icons throughout your application. It automatically handles sizing, styling, and accessibility requirements.

## üì¶ **Import**

```tsx
import { Icon } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';
```

## üöÄ **Basic Usage**

### **Simple Icon**
```tsx
<Icon>home</Icon>
```

### **Icon with Size**
```tsx
<Icon size="lg">settings</Icon>
```

### **Icon with Custom Styling**
```tsx
<Icon size="xl" className="text-brand-orange">star</Icon>
```

## üé® **Props Reference**

| Prop | Type | Default | Description |
|------|------|---------|-------------|
| `children` | `string` | **Required** | Material Symbol name (e.g., 'home', 'settings') |
| `size` | `'xs' \| 'sm' \| 'md' \| 'lg' \| 'xl' \| '2xl' \| '3xl' \| string` | `'md'` | Icon size |
| `className` | `string` | `''` | Additional CSS classes |
| `filled` | `boolean` | `false` | Whether icon should be filled (1) or outlined (0) |
| `weight` | `100 \| 200 \| 300 \| 400 \| 500 \| 600 \| 700` | `400` | Font weight |
| `opticalSize` | `number` | `24` | Material Symbols optical size |
| `ariaHidden` | `boolean` | `false` | Hide from screen readers (for decorative icons) |
| `ariaLabel` | `string` | `children` | Accessible label for screen readers |

## üìè **Size Mapping**

| Size | CSS Class | Pixel Size | Use Case |
|------|-----------|------------|----------|
| `xs` | `text-xs` | 12px | Very small icons, inline text |
| `sm` | `text-sm` | 14px | Small icons, compact components |
| `md` | `text-base` | 16px | Default size, most common use |
| `lg` | `text-lg` | 18px | Medium icons, buttons |
| `xl` | `text-xl` | 20px | Large icons, headers |
| `2xl` | `text-2xl` | 24px | Extra large icons, prominent features |
| `3xl` | `text-3xl` | 30px | Very large icons, hero sections |

## üéØ **Common Use Cases**

### **1. Inline with Text**
```tsx
<p className="text-lg flex items-center gap-2">
  <Icon>info</Icon>
  <span>Informational text</span>
</p>
```

### **2. Icon Buttons (Accessible)**
```tsx
<button 
  className="p-2.5 rounded-md hover:bg-bg-tertiary"
  aria-label="Open settings"
>
  <Icon size="lg">settings</Icon>
</button>
```

### **3. Decorative Icons (Hidden from Screen Readers)**
```tsx
<div className="flex items-center gap-2">
  <Icon ariaHidden={true}>star</Icon>
  <span>Premium Feature</span>
</div>
```

### **4. Custom Styling with Design System Colors**
```tsx
<Icon 
  size="2xl" 
  weight={600} 
  filled={true}
  className="text-system-success"
  ariaLabel="Success indicator"
>
  check_circle
</Icon>
```

### **5. Different Weights and Styles**
```tsx
{/* Light weight */}
<Icon weight={300}>favorite</Icon>

{/* Medium weight */}
<Icon weight={500}>favorite</Icon>

{/* Bold weight */}
<Icon weight={700}>favorite</Icon>

{/* Filled variant */}
<Icon filled={true}>favorite</Icon>
```

## üîó **Component Integration Examples**

### **Button Component**
```tsx
import { Button, Icon } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';

// Left icon
<Button leftIcon={<Icon size="sm">add</Icon>}>
  Add Item
</Button>

// Right icon
<Button rightIcon={<Icon size="sm">arrow_forward</Icon>}>
  Continue
</Button>

// Both icons
<Button 
  leftIcon={<Icon size="sm">save</Icon>}
  rightIcon={<Icon size="sm">check</Icon>}
>
  Save & Continue
</Button>
```

### **Sidebar Component**
```tsx
import { Sidebar, Icon } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';

const navigationItems = [
  {
    label: 'Dashboard',
    icon: <Icon size="sm">dashboard</Icon>,
    href: '/dashboard'
  },
  {
    label: 'Settings',
    icon: <Icon size="sm">settings</Icon>,
    href: '/settings'
  }
];

<Sidebar items={navigationItems} />
```

### **SearchBar Component**
```tsx
import { SearchBar, Icon } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';

// Custom search icon
<SearchBar 
  searchIcon="search"
  placeholder="Search..."
/>

// The SearchBar automatically uses proper Icon sizing
```

### **Header Component**
```tsx
import { Header, Icon } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';

const headerLinks = [
  {
    label: 'Notifications',
    icon: <Icon size="sm">notifications</Icon>,
    href: '/notifications'
  }
];

<Header links={headerLinks} />
```

### **Alert Component**
```tsx
import { Alert, Icon } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';

// Alert automatically uses proper icon sizing based on size prop
<Alert 
  size="lg"
  variant="success"
  title="Success!"
  content="Your changes have been saved."
/>

// Custom icon
<Alert 
  size="md"
  variant="info"
  title="Custom Alert"
  customIcon={<Icon size="md">info</Icon>}
/>
```

### **Form Components**
```tsx
import { Input, Select, Icon } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';

// Input with icon
<Input 
  leftIcon={<Icon size="sm">search</Icon>}
  placeholder="Search..."
/>

// Select with custom option icons
<Select>
  <Select.Option 
    value="option1"
    icon={<Icon size="sm">home</Icon>}
  >
    Home
  </Select.Option>
</Select>
```

## üé® **Design System Integration**

### **Automatic Color Inheritance**
The Icon component automatically inherits text colors from its parent:

```tsx
{/* Icon will be blue */}
<div className="text-system-info">
  <Icon>info</Icon>
</div>

{/* Icon will be green */}
<div className="text-system-success">
  <Icon>check_circle</Icon>
</div>
```

### **Responsive Sizing**
Icons automatically scale with their container:

```tsx
{/* Icon will be 16px (md) by default */}
<div className="text-base">
  <Icon>home</Icon>
</div>

{/* Icon will be 20px (xl) */}
<div className="text-xl">
  <Icon>home</Icon>
</div>
```

## ‚ôø **Accessibility**

### **Interactive Icons**
Always provide accessible labels for interactive icons:

```tsx
<button aria-label="Close dialog">
  <Icon>close</Icon>
</button>
```

### **Decorative Icons**
Hide decorative icons from screen readers:

```tsx
<Icon ariaHidden={true}>star</Icon>
```

### **Informative Icons**
Provide descriptive labels for informative icons:

```tsx
<Icon ariaLabel="Error occurred">error</Icon>
```

## üîß **Advanced Usage**

### **Custom Optical Size**
```tsx
<Icon opticalSize={48}>home</Icon>
```

### **Custom Size with Tailwind Classes**
```tsx
<Icon size="text-4xl">home</Icon>
```

### **Combined Props**
```tsx
<Icon 
  size="2xl"
  weight={600}
  filled={true}
  opticalSize={32}
  className="text-brand-orange hover:text-brand-orange-hover transition-colors"
  ariaLabel="Important notification"
>
  notifications
</Icon>
```

## üéØ **Best Practices**

### **‚úÖ DO:**
- Use semantic icon names that match their purpose
- Provide `aria-label` for interactive icons
- Use `ariaHidden={true}` for purely decorative icons
- Leverage the design system's color classes
- Use appropriate sizes for context

### **‚ùå DON'T:**
- Use icons without considering accessibility
- Mix different icon families (stick to Material Symbols)
- Use icons for pure decoration without hiding from screen readers
- Override the component's built-in centering styles
- Use hardcoded pixel values when size props are available

## üöÄ **Automatic Functionality**

The Icon component works automatically with the design system:

1. **Font Loading**: Automatically detects and loads Material Symbols font
2. **Color Inheritance**: Inherits colors from parent elements
3. **Responsive Scaling**: Scales with container text size
4. **Accessibility**: Provides proper ARIA attributes by default
5. **Centering**: Automatically centers icons within containers
6. **Error Handling**: Gracefully handles missing icons with warnings

## üìö **Available Icons**

The component supports all Material Symbols icons. Common ones include:

- **Navigation**: `home`, `menu`, `arrow_back`, `arrow_forward`, `close`
- **Actions**: `add`, `edit`, `delete`, `save`, `cancel`, `refresh`
- **Status**: `check_circle`, `error`, `warning`, `info`, `help`
- **Communication**: `email`, `phone`, `chat`, `notifications`
- **Content**: `favorite`, `star`, `bookmark`, `share`
- **System**: `settings`, `account_circle`, `lock`, `visibility`

For a complete list, visit [Material Symbols](https://fonts.google.com/icons).

## üìã **Best Practices**

### **‚úÖ DO:**
- Use the `size` prop instead of hardcoded CSS classes
- Provide `aria-label` for interactive icons
- Use `ariaHidden={true}` for decorative icons
- Leverage the design system's color classes
- Use appropriate sizes for context

### **‚ùå DON'T:**
- Use hardcoded `w-` and `h-` classes: `<Icon className="w-4 h-4">`
- Use hardcoded `!text-` classes: `<Icon className="!text-xl">`
- Mix different icon families (stick to Material Symbols)
- Use icons for pure decoration without hiding from screen readers
- Override the component's built-in centering styles

### **Size Guidelines:**
- **`xs`**: Very small icons, inline text (12px)
- **`sm`**: Small icons, compact components (14px)
- **`md`**: Default size, most common use (16px)
- **`lg`**: Medium icons, buttons (18px)
- **`xl`**: Large icons, headers (20px)
- **`2xl`**: Extra large icons, hero sections (24px)
- **`3xl`**: Very large icons, empty states (30px)

### **Common Patterns:**
```tsx
// Navigation icons
<Icon size="sm">home</Icon>

// Button icons
<Icon size="sm">add</Icon>

// Status indicators
<Icon size="md" className="text-system-success">check_circle</Icon>

// Interactive icons
<Icon size="lg" aria-label="Settings">settings</Icon>

// Decorative icons
<Icon size="2xl" ariaHidden={true}>star</Icon>
```

## üîç **Troubleshooting**

### **Icons Not Displaying**
1. Ensure Material Symbols font is loaded in your HTML with full range support:
   ```html
   <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Material+Symbols+Outlined:opsz,wght,FILL,GRAD@20..48,100..700,0..1,0..200">
   ```
2. Check that the icon name is correct
3. Verify the font is properly imported

### **Filled Icons or Weight Changes Not Working**
1. Ensure you're using the full range font URL (not the limited version)
2. Check browser developer tools to verify font variation settings are applied
3. Clear browser cache to ensure new font is loaded

### **Icons Not Centering**
1. The component handles centering automatically
2. Avoid overriding the built-in centering styles
3. Use the component's size props instead of custom CSS

### **Build Errors**
1. Make sure you're using the `size` prop instead of hardcoded classes
2. Check that all Icon components are properly imported
3. Verify that the font loading URL is correct

### **Accessibility Issues**
1. Always provide `aria-label` for interactive icons
2. Use `ariaHidden={true}` for decorative icons
3. Test with screen readers

## üéâ **Ready to Use!**

The Icon component is fully integrated with the Acutrack Design System and works automatically. Simply import and use with confidence!
